Label: AL rdfs:label@en
Definition: AL IAO:0000115@en
Derives from: C 'derives from' some % and 'derives from' only %

Label: Beaujolais wine
Definition: Beaujolais is a French Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée (AOC) wine generally made of the Gamay grape which has a thin skin and is low in tannins.

Label: Bordeaux wine
Definition: A Bordeaux wine is any wine produced in the Bordeaux region of southwest France.

Label: Zakynthos Wine
Definition: Zakynthos Wine is wine produced on the Greek island of Zakynthos (Zante) in the Ionian Sea. A wide array of native Ionian grape varieties have been planted on the island for centuries, and are most famously used to make the intensely flavored, highly acidic Verdea wine.

Label: Reserve wine
Definition: Reserve wine is wine of a higher quality than usual, or a wine that has been aged before being sold, or both. Traditionally, winemakers would reserve some of their best wine rather than sell it immediately, coining the term.

Label: Chablis wine
Definition: Chablis wine is a wine made in the Chablis region of France.

Label: Cabernet Sauvignon wine
Definition: A Cabernet Sauvignon wine is any wine produced using only Cabernet Sauvignon grapes. It often appears with Merlot and Cabernet Franc in blended Bordeaux wines.

Label: Cabernet Sauvignon grape plant
Definition: The Cabernet Sauvignon grape plant originates from a cross between Cabernet Franc and Sauvignon blanc varieties. It produces Cabernet Sauvignon grapes, a red wine grape variety.

Label: Chardonnay wine
Definition: Chardonnay wine is wine produced using only Chardonnay grapes.

Label: Chardonnay grape plant
Definition: The Chardonnay grape plant is the result of a cross between the Pinot noir and Gouais blanc (Heunisch) grape varieties. It produces a green-skinned grape variety used in the production of white wine.

Label: Chenin blanc wine
Definition: A Chenin blanc wine is any wine produced using only Chenin blanc grapes.

Label: Chenin blanc grape plant
Definition: Chenin blanc grapes are a White wine grape variety from the Loire Valley of France. Its high acidity means it can be used to make everything from sparkling wines to well-balanced dessert wines, although it can produce very bland, neutral wines if the vine's natural vigor is not controlled.

Label: Malbec wine
Definition: A Malbec wine is any wine produced using only Malbec grapes.

Label: Malbec grape plant
Definition: Malbec grapes are a purple grape variety used in making red wine. The grapes tend to have an inky dark color and robust tannins, and are known as one of the six grapes allowed in the blend of red Bordeaux wine. The French plantations of Malbec are now found primarily in Cahors in South West France. It is increasingly celebrated as an Argentine varietal wine and is being grown around the world.

Label: Merlot wine
Definition: A Merlot wine is any wine produced using only Merlot grapes.

Label: Merlot grape plant
Definition: Merlot is a dark blue-colored wine grape variety, that is used as both a blending grape and for varietal wines.

Label: Pinot blanc wine
Definition: A pinot blanc wine is any wine produced using only Pinco blanc grapes.

Label: Pinot blanc grape plant
Definition: Pinot blanc is a white wine grape. It is a point genetic mutation of Pinot noir.

Label: Pinot gris wine
Definition: Pinot gris is a white wine varietal produced only from Pinot gris grapes.  The Italian synonym, Pinot Grigio, has become strongly associated with lighter wines produced in great quantities, particularly in northern Italy.

Label: Pinot gris grape plant
Definition: Pinot gris is a white wine grape variety (mutation) of the Pinot family which shares its genetic fingerprint with Pinot Noir, Pinot Blanc et al. . Pinot gris is grown around the globe with the "spicy" full-bodied Alsatian and lighter-bodied, more acidic Italian styles being most widely recognized.

Label: Pinot noir wine
Definition: Pinot noir wine is a red wine varietal made only from Pinot noir grapes.  The thin skins and low levels of phenolic compounds lends pinot to producing mostly lightly colored, medium-bodied and low-tannin wines that can often go through phases of uneven and unpredictable aging.

Label: Pinot noir grape plant
Definition: Pinot noir grape is a red wine grape variety. The name is derived from the French words for pine and black. The word pine alludes to the grape variety having tightly clustered, pine cone-shaped bunches of fruit. Pinot noir grapes are grown around the world, mostly in the cooler climates, and the grape is chiefly associated with the Burgundy region of France.

Label: Pinotage wine
Definition: Pinotage wine is a red wine varietal produced only from Pinotage grapes. This type of wine can range from a fairly cheap, light-bodied red wine with some funky aromas (including extremes such as acetone, paint, rubber, and at times banana) all the way to full-bodied red wines with balance, elegance, fully developed black fruit flavors, and an enduring, sweet, smokey finish.

Label: Pinotage grape plant
Definition: Pinotage is a red wine grape that is South Africa's signature variety. It was bred there in 1925 as a crossbetween Pinot noir and Cinsaut. The grape is a viticultural intraspecific cross of two varieties of Vitis vinifera, not an interspecific hybrid.

Label: Riesling wine
Definition: Riesling wine is a white wine varietal produced only from Riesling grapes, and offered as dry, semi-sweet, sweet, and sparkling white wines. Riesling wines are usually varietally pure and are seldom oaked.

Label: Riesling grape plant
Definition: Riesling grape is an aromatic white grape variety displaying flowery, almost perfumed, aromas as well as high acidity.

Label: Sangiovese wine
Definition: Sangiovese wine is a red wine varietal produced only from Sangiovese grapes. It is prized for its high acid, firm tannins and balanced nature. Savory flavors of dark cherries and black stonefruit are characteristic, and may be backed by secondary notes of tomato leaf and dried herbs.

Label: Sangiovese grape plant
Definition: Sangiovese is a red Italian wine grape variety that derives its name from the Latin sanguis Jovis, "the blood of Jupiter".

Label: Sauvignon blanc wine
Definition: Sauvignon blanc wine is a white wine varietal produced only from Sauvignon blanc grapes.  Its primary fruit flavors are lime, green apple, passion fruit and white peach. Depending on how ripe the grapes are when the wine is made, the flavor will range from zesty lime to flowery peach.
Sauvignon jaune | Blanc fume | Fume blanc

Label: Sauvignon blanc grape plant
Definition: Sauvignon blanc is a green-skinned grape variety that originates from the Bordeaux region of France. The grape most likely gets its name from the French words sauvage ("wild") and blanc ("white") due to its early origins as an indigenous grape in South West France.

Label: Semillon wine
Definition: Semillon wine is a white wine varietal produced only from Semillon grapes.  The primary fruit flavors in Semillon wine are lemon, apple, pear and green papaya. Semillon is France’s 3rd most planted white wine variety behind Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay.

Label: Semillon grape plant
Definition: Semillon is a golden-skinned grape used to make dry and sweet white wines, mostly in France and Australia.

Label: Glera wine
Definition: Glera wine is a white wine varietal produced only from Glera grapes.

Label: Glera grape plant
Definition: Glera is a white variety of grape of Slovenian origin, which was brought to the village of Prosecco from Slovenia's Karst region. Glera was, until 2009, mostly referred to as Prosecco. It is mainly cultivated for use in sparkling Italian wine styles.

Label: Prosecco wine
Definition: Prosecco is an Italian white wine varietal produced primarily from Glera grapes, but other grape varieties may be included. Prosecco controlled designation of origin can be spumante ("sparkling wine"), frizzante ("semi-sparkling wine"), or tranquillo ("still wine").

Label: Syrah wine
Definition: Syrah wine is a white wine produced entirely from Syrah grapes.  The wines are often powerfully flavoured and full-bodied.

Label: Syrah grape plant
Definition: Syrah is a dark-skinned grape variety grown throughout the world and used primarily to produce red wine. In 1999, Syrah was found to be the offspring of two obscure grapes from southeastern France, Dureza and Mondeuse Blanche.

SciBite synonym: Ull de Llebre | Cencibel | Tinta del Pais | Aragonez | Tinta Roriz
Label: Tempranillo wine
Definition: Tempranillo wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Tempranillo grapes.

Label: Tempranillo grape plant
Definition: Tempranillo is a black grape variety widely grown to make full-bodied red wines in its native Spain.
Ull de Llebre | Cencibel | Tinta del Pais

Label: Zinfandel wine
Definition: Zinfandel wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Zinfandel grapes.  A classic wine is high in both alcohol and tannins, intensely flavored and deeply colored.

Label: Zinfandel grape plant
Definition: Zinfandel is a variety of black-skinned wine grape.

Label: Frappato wine
Definition: Frappato wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Frappato grapes.  As a varietal, Frappato produces light bodied wines with a distinct grapey aroma.
Frappato Nero | Frappato Nero di Vittoria | Frappatu | Frappatu di Vittoria | Nerello| Nerello di Catania | Nero Capitano.

Label: Frappato grape plant
Definition: Frappato di Vittoria or Frappato is a red Italian wine grape variety planted primarily in Sicily.

Label: Gamay noir wine
Definition: Gamay noir wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Gamay grapes.

Label: Gamay grape plant
Definition: Gamay is a purple-colored grape variety used to make red wines, most notably grown in Beaujolais and in the Loire Valley around Tours.

Label: Gewürztraminer wine
Definition: Gewürztraminerwine is a white wine varietal produced entirely from Gewürztraminer grapes.

Label: Gewürztraminer grape plant
Definition: Gewürztraminer is an aromatic wine grape variety, used in white wines, and performs best in cooler climates.

Label: Carignane wine
Definition: Carignane wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Carignane grapes.

Label: Carignane grape plant
Definition: Carignan (also known as Carignane) is a red grape variety of Spanish origin that is more commonly found in French wine but is widely planted throughout the western Mediterranean and around the globe.

Label: Grenache wine
Definition: Grenache wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Grenache grapes.

Label: Grenache grape plant
Definition: Grenache is one of the most widely planted red wine grape varieties in the world.

Label: Barbera wine
Definition: Barbera wine is a red wine varietal produced entirely from Barbera grapes.

Label: Barbera grape plant
Definition: Barbera is a red Italian wine grape variety that, as of 2000, was the third most-planted red grape variety in Italy (after Sangiovese and Montepulciano). It produces good yields and is known for deep color, full body, low tannins and high levels of acid.

Label: tagliatelle
Definition: Tagliatelle is a traditional type of egg pasta from the Emilia-Romagna and Marche regions of Italy. Individual pieces of tagliatelle are long, flat ribbons that are similar in shape to fettuccine and are typically about 6.5 to 10 mm (0.26 to 0.39 in) wide.

Label: tortellini
Definition: Tortellini are ring-shaped pasta, sometimes also described as "navel shaped", hence their alternative name of "belly button" (ombelico). They are typically stuffed with a mix of meat (pork loin, raw prosciutto, Mortadella), and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.

Label: tortelloni
Definition: Tortelloni are stuffed pasta, the same shape as tortellini, but larger. They are usually stuffed with ricotta cheese and leaf vegetables, such as spinach.

Label: tortiglioni
Definition: Tortiglioni are a type of pasta, similar to rigatoni but larger and with deeper grooves which spiral around the pasta.

Label: fusilli
Definition: Fusilli are a variety of pasta that are formed into corkscrew or helical shapes. The word fusilli presumably comes from fuso ("spindle"), as traditionally it is "spun" by pressing and rolling a small rod over the thin strips of pasta to wind them around it in a corkscrew shape.

Label: conchiglie
Definition: Conchiglie, commonly known as "shells" or "seashells" is a type of pasta. It is usually sold in the plain durum wheat variety. The shell shape of the pasta allows the sauce to adhere to it.

Label: linguine
Definition: Linguine is a type of pasta similar to fettuccine and trenette but elliptical in section rather than flat. It is about 4 millimetres in width, which is wider than spaghetti but not as wide as fettuccine.

Label: penne
Definition: Penne is an extruded type of pasta with cylinder-shaped pieces, their ends cut at a bias. It is lexically related to Latin penna (meaning "feather" or "quill"), and was originally intended to imitate the then-ubiquitous fountain pen's steel nibs.
